intro: Begonia josephi var. minima, commonly known as the miniature begonia, is a compact, trailing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It features small, heart-shaped leaves that are typically a deep green with a velvety texture. The plant produces delicate, spurred flowers in shades of red, pink, or white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers consistently moist, well-draining soil. Due to its ornamental value and ease of care, it is a popular choice for hanging baskets and indoor gardens.
